headline: Kimberly-Clark Overhaul Tests Dividend Record And Perceived Valuation Upside
summary: Kimberly-Clark (NasdaqGS:KMB) is undergoing what management describes as its largest transformation in 150 years. Capital spending tied to this overhaul led the company to pay more in dividends than it generated in free cash flow last year. The move is raising fresh questions about how sustainable its long record of 54 consecutive years of dividend increases will be. For income focused investors watching NasdaqGS:KMB, the key tension is clear. Kimberly-Clark has built its reputation on...
